title: Drawing, "Adoration of the Shepherds", 18th century
medium: Brush and brown ink, wash on cream laid paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower left: Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum, Smithsonial Institution (Lugt 457d); stamp in brown ink, verso: Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum, Smithsonial Institution (Lugt 457e)
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper left: Vol V- Num III
dimensions:
Mount: 31.3 x 21.9 cm (12 5/16 x 8 5/8 in.), irregular
Image: 30.8 x 21.1 cm (12 1/8 x 8 5/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Virgin touches Child with left hand as figures look on. Shepherds visible on right, with cherubim overhead flying in the clouds. Architectural background at right.
